newsitem.title: UK: S&P rates Venantius Swedish CP A1 plus short-term.
newsitem.headline: S&P rates Venantius Swedish CP A1 plus short-term.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Friday it assigned its A1 plus short-term rating to Venantius AB's three billion Swedish crown Swedish commercial paper programme.
Venantius is wholly-owned by the Kingdom of Sweden and there is no present or future intention to privatise the company, S&P said.
"Venantius' ratings reflect the company's strong relationship with the Kingdom of Sweden, which has AA plus/A1 plus foreign currency and AAA local currency debt ratings," S&P said.
"The outlook for the sovereign long-term foreign currency rating is negative, while the outlook for the local currency rating is stable," S&P said.

Venantius has been established with the sole purpose of managing and financing housing loans approved by public authorities in the past, and to minimise the losses pertaining to these loans for the State, S&P said.

"Venantius has a strong public sector role, and as such has strong backing from the Kingdom by way of its equity investment, funding facilities and net worth guarantee. In addition, noteholders benefit from a conditional guarantee which can be used if the net worth guarantee is withdrawn or to meet claims in bankruptcy," S&P said.
